title: I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings

cover.description: Cover of 2009 mass market paperback edition.
cover.alt: Orange book cover showing a black silhoutte of a bird flying upward, with a stylized yellow sun in the background.  The top half of the cover has the text 'Maya Angelou / I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings'.  In smaller type in the lower right corner is the text 'Foreword by Oprah Winfrey'.

overview: Maya Angelou's first memoir tells the story of her growing up in the segregated South, dealing with racism, sexual abuse and assault, teenage pregnancy, and homelessness.  A best-seller that has stayed in print since its debut, the book was acclaimed by Time magazine as {ln:https://time.com/archive/7125933/all-time-100-best-nonfiction-books/|one of the 100 best nonfiction books of all time}.

incidents.description: This book was one of {ln:https://www.navy.mil/Press-Office/Press-Releases/display-pressreleases/Article/4146516/list-of-books-removed-from-usna-library/|over 350 books removed from the US Naval Academy Library} in response to an order from Defense Secretary Pete Hegsethâ€™s office to {ln:https://apnews.com/article/military-academies-dei-hegseth-trump-ba9731f24b4eb4bd9c02b568209f97af|'review and get rid of [books] that promote diversity, equity and inclusion'}, as reported by the Associated Press. In response, Jinny Amundson, co-owner of Annapolis's {ln:https://www.oldfoxbooks.com/|Old Fox Books}, has organized {ln:https://wtop.com/maryland/2025/04/operation-caged-bird-takes-flight-after-naval-academy-removes-381-books-under-from-its-library/|Operation Caged Bird}, which will provide free copies of any of the books on the banned list to midshipmen at the Academy.
